verses.verse: A Prayer<WH8605> of Moses<WH4872> the man<WH376> of God<WH430>. Lord<WH136>, thou hast been our dwelling place<WH4583> in all<WH1755> generations<WH1755>. A Prayer: or, A Prayer, being a Psalm of Moses in: Heb. in generation and generation

Before the mountains<WH2022> were brought forth<WH3205>, or ever thou hadst formed<WH2342> the earth<WH776> and the world<WH8398>, even from everlasting<WH5769> to<WH5704> everlasting<WH5769>, thou art God<WH410>.
Thou turnest<WH7725> man<WH582> to destruction<WH1793>; and sayest<WH559>, Return<WH7725>, ye children<WH1121> of men<WH120>.
For a thousand<WH505> years<WH8141> in thy sight<WH5869> are but as<WH3117> yesterday<WH865> when it is past<WH5674>, and as a watch<WH821> in the night<WH3915>. when: or, when he hath passed them
Thou carriest them away as with a flood<WH2229>; they are as a sleep<WH8142>: in the morning<WH1242> they are like grass<WH2682> which groweth up<WH2498>. groweth: or, is changed
In the morning<WH1242> it flourisheth<WH6692>, and groweth up<WH2498>; in the evening<WH6153> it is cut down<WH4135>, and withereth<WH3001>.
For we are consumed<WH3615> by thine anger<WH639>, and by thy wrath<WH2534> are we troubled<WH926>.
Thou hast set<WH7896> our iniquities<WH5771> before thee, our secret<WH5956> sins in the light<WH3974> of thy countenance<WH6440>.
For all our days<WH3117> are passed away<WH6437> in thy wrath<WH5678>: we spend<WH3615> our years<WH8141> as a tale<WH1899> that is told. passed: Heb. turned away as a: or, as a meditation

The days<WH3117> of our years<WH8141> are threescore<WH7657> years<WH8141> and ten<WH7657>; and if by reason of strength<WH1369> they be fourscore<WH8084> years<WH8141>, yet is their strength<WH7296> labour<WH5999> and sorrow<WH205>; for it is soon<WH2440> cut off<WH1468>, and we fly away<WH5774>. The days: Heb. As for the days of our years, in them are seventy years
Who knoweth<WH3045> the power<WH5797> of thine anger<WH639>? even according to thy fear<WH3374>, so is thy wrath<WH5678>.
So teach<WH3045> us to number<WH4487> our days<WH3117>, that we may apply<WH935> our hearts<WH3824> unto wisdom<WH2451>. apply: Heb. cause to come
Return<WH7725>, O LORD<WH3068>, how long? and let it repent<WH5162> thee concerning thy servants<WH5650>.
O satisfy<WH7646> us early<WH1242> with thy mercy<WH2617>; that we may rejoice<WH7442> and be glad<WH8055> all our days<WH3117>.
Make us glad<WH8055> according to the days<WH3117> wherein thou hast afflicted<WH6031> us, and the years<WH8141> wherein we have seen<WH7200> evil<WH7451>.
Let thy work<WH6467> appear<WH7200> unto thy servants<WH5650>, and thy glory<WH1926> unto their children<WH1121>.

And let the beauty<WH5278> of the LORD<WH3068> our God<WH430> be upon us: and establish<WH3559> thou the work<WH4639> of our hands<WH3027> upon us; yea, the work<WH4639> of our hands<WH3027> establish<WH3559> thou it.
